info.description: Use the Transaction Search API to get the history of transactions for a PayPal account. To use the API on behalf of third parties, you must be part of the PayPal partner network. Reach out to your partner manager for the next steps. To enroll in the partner program, see Partner with PayPal. For more information about the API, see the Transaction Search API Integration Guide.
info.title: Transaction Search

definitions.description: The PayPal payer ID, which is a masked version of the PayPal account number intended for use with third parties. The account number is reversibly encrypted and a proprietary variant of Base32 is used to encode the result.
definitions.name: account_id

properties.description: The PayPal payer ID, which is a masked version of the PayPal account number intended for use with third parties. The account number is reversibly encrypted and a proprietary variant of Base32 is used to encode the result.
properties.name: account_id

definitions.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.
definitions.name: address
definitions.title: Simple Postal Address (Coarse-Grained)

properties.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street.
properties.name: line1

properties.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.
properties.name: line2

properties.description: The city name.
properties.name: city

properties.description: The [code](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/) for a US state or the equivalent for other countries. Required for transactions if the address is in one of these countries: [Argentina](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#argentina), [Brazil](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#brazil), [Canada](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#canada), [China](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#china), [India](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#india), [Italy](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#italy), [Japan](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#japan), [Mexico](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#mexico), [Thailand](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#thailand), or [United States](/api/rest/reference/state-codes/#usa). Maximum length is 40 single-byte characters.
properties.name: state

properties.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.
properties.name: country_code

properties.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).
properties.name: postal_code

properties.description: The name of the auction site.
properties.name: auction_site

properties.description: The auction site URL.
properties.name: auction_item_site

properties.description: The ID of the buyer who makes the purchase in the auction. This ID might be different from the payer ID provided for the payment.
properties.name: auction_buyer_id

properties.description: The date and time when the auction closes, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: auction_closing_date

properties.description: Currency Code of the balances listed.
properties.name: currency

properties.description: Optional field representing if the currency is primary currency or not.
properties.name: primary

properties.description: The total amount in PayPal account. It is the sum of all the other balances.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: total_balance

properties.description: The amount of cash in an Account which is at the customer's disposal. This amount is captured at settlement cutoff time in the user's time zone as defined for the user.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: available_balance

properties.description: Balance withheld in the account. The portion of funds that PayPal holds for the customer that is not currently at the customer's disposal.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: withheld_balance

properties.description: An array of balance detail objects.
properties.name: balances

properties.description: The PayPal payer ID, which is a masked version of the PayPal account number intended for use with third parties. The account number is reversibly encrypted and a proprietary variant of Base32 is used to encode the result.
properties.name: account_id

properties.description: The requested date and time or the last date and time when the balances can be served, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: as_of_time

properties.description: The date and time when the balances was last refreshed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: last_refresh_time

properties.description: An array of item details.
properties.name: item_details

properties.description: Indicates whether the item amount or the shipping amount already includes tax.
properties.name: tax_inclusive

properties.description: The ID of the invoice. Appears for only PayPal-generated invoices.
properties.name: paypal_invoice_id

definitions.description: A checkout option as a name-and-value pair.
definitions.name: checkout_option
definitions.title: Checkout Option

properties.description: The checkout option name, such as `color` or `texture`.
properties.name: checkout_option_name

properties.description: The checkout option value. For example, the checkout option `color` might be `blue` or `red` while the checkout option `texture` might be `smooth` or `rippled`.
properties.name: checkout_option_value

definitions.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.
definitions.name: country_code

properties.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.
properties.name: country_code

definitions.description:
Quantity of a cryptocurrency asset.
This is a decimal number with scale defined for each Cryptocurrency by the founders. For example,
  • Bitcoin(BTC) has 8 as scale,
  • Ethereum (ETH) has 18 as scale.

    • PayPal Cryptocurrency platform handles the scale to 8 digits for Bitcoin and its forks or offshoots and Ehereum.
definitions.name: cryptocurrency_quantity

properties.description:
Quantity of a cryptocurrency asset.
This is a decimal number with scale defined for each Cryptocurrency by the founders. For example,
  • Bitcoin(BTC) has 8 as scale,
  • Ethereum (ETH) has 18 as scale.

    • PayPal Cryptocurrency platform handles the scale to 8 digits for Bitcoin and its forks or offshoots and Ehereum.
properties.name: cryptocurrency_quantity

definitions.description: The Cryptocurrency ticker symbol / code as assigned by liquidity providers (exchanges).
definitions.name: cryptocurrency_symbol

properties.description: The Cryptocurrency ticker symbol / code as assigned by liquidity providers (exchanges).
properties.name: cryptocurrency_symbol

definitions.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.
definitions.name: currency_code

properties.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.
properties.name: currency_code

definitions.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.
definitions.name: currency_code

properties.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.
properties.name: currency_code

definitions.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.
definitions.name: date_time

properties.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.
properties.name: date_time

definitions.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.
definitions.name: email_address

properties.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.
properties.name: email_address

properties.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.
properties.name: debug_id

properties.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

properties.description: An array of additional details about the error.

definitions.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.
definitions.name: error_details
definitions.title: Error Details

properties.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.
properties.name: field

properties.description: The value of the field that caused the error.
properties.name: value

properties.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.
properties.name: location

properties.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.
properties.name: issue

properties.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.
properties.name: description

definitions.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.
definitions.name: error_details
definitions.title: Error Details

properties.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.
properties.name: field

properties.description: The value of the field that caused the error.
properties.name: value

properties.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.
properties.name: location

properties.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.
properties.name: issue

properties.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.
properties.name: description

properties.description: The type of incentive, such as a special offer or coupon.
properties.name: incentive_type

properties.description: The code that identifies an incentive, such as a coupon.
properties.name: incentive_code

properties.description: The incentive amount.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: incentive_amount

properties.description: The incentive program code that identifies a merchant loyalty or incentive program.
properties.name: incentive_program_code

properties.description: An array of incentive details.
properties.name: incentive_details

properties.description: An item code that identifies a merchant's goods or service.
properties.name: item_code

properties.description: The item name.
properties.name: item_name

properties.description: The item description.
properties.name: item_description

properties.description: The item options. Describes option choices on the purchase of the item in some detail.
properties.name: item_options

properties.description: The number of purchased units of goods or a service.
properties.name: item_quantity

properties.description: The cost for each instance of goods or a service.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: item_unit_price

properties.description: The amount of the payment for the item.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: item_amount

properties.description: The reduction in price associated with goods or a service.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: discount_amount

properties.description: An increment or decrement to a purchase amount.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: adjustment_amount

properties.description: The amount of money charged for gift wrapping an item.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: gift_wrap_amount

properties.description: A rate, expressed in hundreds, that is used to calculate a levy for the purchase of goods or services.
properties.name: tax_percentage

properties.description: An array of tax amounts levied by a government on the purchase of goods or services.
properties.name: tax_amounts

properties.description: The delivery cost.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: basic_shipping_amount

properties.description: The cost for expedited delivery of the goods.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: extra_shipping_amount

properties.description: A charge for processing the purchase of goods or services.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: handling_amount

properties.description: A charge for guaranteeing the quality of a product or delivery of a product.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: insurance_amount

properties.description: The sum of all factors, item cost, discounts, tax, shipping, and so on, that goes into the cost of an item.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: total_item_amount

properties.description: The invoice number. An alphanumeric string that identifies a billing for a merchant.
properties.name: invoice_number

properties.description: An array of checkout options. Each option has a name and value.
properties.name: checkout_options

definitions.description: The tax levied by a government on the purchase of goods or services.
definitions.name: item_detail_tax_amount
definitions.title: Tax Amount

properties.description: The tax levied by a government on the purchase of goods or services.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: tax_amount

properties.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.
properties.name: href

properties.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).
properties.name: rel

properties.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.
properties.name: method

properties.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.
properties.name: href

properties.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).
properties.name: rel

properties.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.
properties.name: method

definitions.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.
definitions.name: money
definitions.title: Money

properties.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.
properties.name: currency_code

properties.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).
properties.name: value

definitions.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.
definitions.name: money
definitions.title: Money

properties.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.
properties.name: currency_code

properties.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).
properties.name: value

properties.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.
properties.name: prefix

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.
properties.name: given_name

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.
properties.name: surname

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.
properties.name: middle_name

properties.description: The suffix for the party's name.
properties.name: suffix

properties.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.
properties.name: alternate_full_name

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.
properties.name: full_name

properties.description: The PayPal` customer account ID.
properties.name: account_id

properties.description: The email address of the payer.
properties.name: email_address

properties.description: The primary phone number of the payer.
properties.title: Phone
properties.name: phone_number

properties.description:
The address status of the payer. Value is either:
  • Y. Verified.
  • N. Not verified.
properties.name: address_status

properties.description: The status of the payer. Value is `Y` or `N`.
properties.name: payer_status

properties.description: The payer name.
properties.title: Name
properties.name: payer_name

properties.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/api/rest/reference/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region of the payer.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.
properties.name: country_code

properties.description: The payer address.
properties.title: Simple Postal Address (Coarse-Grained)
properties.name: address

definitions.description: The percentage, as a fixed-point, signed decimal number. For example, define a 19.99% interest rate as `19.99`.
definitions.name: percentage

properties.description: The percentage, as a fixed-point, signed decimal number. For example, define a 19.99% interest rate as `19.99`.
properties.name: percentage

definitions.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).
definitions.name: phone
definitions.title: Phone

properties.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).
properties.name: country_code

properties.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).
properties.name: national_number

properties.description: The extension number.
properties.name: extension_number

properties.description: An array of transaction detail objects.
properties.name: transaction_details

properties.description: The merchant account number.
properties.name: account_number

properties.description: The start date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: start_date

properties.description: The end date and time or the last date when the data can be served, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: end_date

properties.description: The date and time when the data was last refreshed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: last_refreshed_datetime

properties.description: A zero-relative index of transactions.
properties.name: page

properties.description: The total number of transactions as an integer beginning with the specified `page` in the full result and not just in this response.
properties.name: total_items

properties.description: The total number of pages, as an `integer`, when the `total_items` is divided into pages of the specified `page_size`.
properties.name: total_pages

properties.description: An array of request-related [HATEOAS links](/api/rest/responses/#hateoas-linkss).
properties.name: links

properties.description: The recipient's name.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The shipping method that is associated with this order.
properties.name: method

properties.description: The shipping address that is associated with this order.
properties.title: Simple Postal Address (Coarse-Grained)
properties.name: address

properties.description: The secondary shipping address that is associated with this order.
properties.title: Simple Postal Address (Coarse-Grained)
properties.name: secondary_shipping_address

properties.description: The ID of a store for a merchant in the system of record.
properties.name: store_id

properties.description: The terminal ID for the checkout stand in a merchant store.
properties.name: terminal_id

properties.description: The transaction information.
properties.title: Transaction Information
properties.name: transaction_info

properties.description: The payer information.
properties.title: Payer Information
properties.name: payer_info

properties.description: The shipping information.
properties.title: Shipping Information
properties.name: shipping_info

properties.description: The cart information.
properties.title: Cart Information
properties.name: cart_info

properties.description: The store information.
properties.title: Store Information
properties.name: store_info

properties.description: The auction information.
properties.title: Auction Information
properties.name: auction_info

properties.description: The incentive information.
properties.title: Incentive Information
properties.name: incentive_info

properties.description: The ID of the PayPal account of the counterparty.
properties.name: paypal_account_id

properties.description: The PayPal-generated transaction ID.
properties.name: transaction_id

properties.description: The PayPal-generated base ID. PayPal exclusive. Cannot be altered. Defined as a related, pre-existing transaction or event.
properties.name: paypal_reference_id

properties.description:
The PayPal reference ID type. Value is:
  • ODR. An order ID.
  • TXN. A transaction ID.
  • SUB. A subscription ID.
  • PAP. A pre-approved payment ID.
properties.name: paypal_reference_id_type

properties.description: A five-digit transaction event code that classifies the transaction type based on money movement and debit or credit. For example, T0001. See [Transaction event codes](/docs/integration/direct/transaction-search/transaction-event-codes/).
properties.name: transaction_event_code

properties.description: The date and time when work on a transaction began in the PayPal system, as expressed in the time zone of the account on this side of the payment. Specify the value in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: transaction_initiation_date

properties.description: The date and time when the transaction was last changed, as expressed in the time zone of the account on this side of the payment. Specify the value in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: transaction_updated_date

properties.description: The all-inclusive gross transaction amount that was transferred between the sender and receiver through PayPal.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: transaction_amount

properties.description:
The PayPal fee amount. All transaction fees are included in this amount, which is the record of fee associated with the transaction.
Note: This field contains a value only when a transaction fee is applied and processed for this transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: fee_amount

properties.description:
The reduction in price offered for goods or services purchased.
Note: This discount is for a price reduction that is offered for other than that at a individual item level.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: discount_amount

properties.description: An insurance charge. Guarantees the quality or delivery of a product.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: insurance_amount

properties.description: The PayPal- or merchant-reported sales tax amount for the transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: sales_tax_amount

properties.description: The PayPal- or merchant-reported shipping amount for the transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: shipping_amount

properties.description: The discount on the shipping amount.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: shipping_discount_amount

properties.description: The tax on the shipping service.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: shipping_tax_amount

properties.description: The special amount that is added to the transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: other_amount

properties.description: The tip.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: tip_amount

properties.description:
A code that indicates the transaction status. Value is:
Status codeDescription
DPayPal or merchant rules denied the transaction.
PThe transaction is pending. The transaction was created but waits for another payment process to complete, such as an ACH transaction, before the status changes to S.
SThe transaction successfully completed without a denial and after any pending statuses.
VA successful transaction was fully reversed and funds were refunded to the original sender.
properties.name: transaction_status

properties.description: The subject of payment. The payer passes this value to the payee. The payer controls this data through the interface through which he or she sends the data.
properties.name: transaction_subject

properties.description: A special note that the payer passes to the payee. Might contain special customer requests, such as shipping instructions.
properties.name: transaction_note

properties.description: The payment tracking ID, which is a unique ID that partners specify to either get information about a payment or request a refund.
properties.name: payment_tracking_id

properties.description: The bank reference ID. The bank provides this value for an ACH transaction.
properties.name: bank_reference_id

properties.description:
The ending balance.
Note: If you specify one or more optional query parameters, the ending_balance response field is empty.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: ending_balance

properties.description: The available amount of transaction currency during the completion of this transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: available_balance

properties.description:
The invoice ID that is sent by the merchant with the transaction.
Note: If an invoice ID was sent with the capture request, the value is reported. Otherwise, the invoice ID of the authorizing transaction is reported.
properties.name: invoice_id

properties.description:
The merchant-provided custom text.
Note: Usually, this field includes the unique ID for payments made with MassPay type transaction.
properties.name: custom_field

properties.description:
Indicates whether the transaction is eligible for protection. Value is:
  • 01. Eligible.
  • 02. Not eligible
  • 03. Partially eligible.
properties.name: protection_eligibility

properties.description: The credit term. The time span covered by the installment payments as expressed in the term length plus the length time unit code.
properties.name: credit_term

properties.description: The overall amount of the credit transaction fee.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: credit_transactional_fee

properties.description: The overall amount of the credit promotional fee.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: credit_promotional_fee

properties.description: The annual percentage rate (APR). Determines the amount of interest a consumer pays to finance a purchase at a merchant.
properties.name: annual_percentage_rate

properties.description:
The payment method that was used for a transaction. Value is PUI, installment, or mEFT.
Note: Appears only for pay upon invoice (PUI), installment, and mEFT transactions. Merchants and partners in the EMEA region can use this attribute to note transactions that attract turn-over tax.
properties.name: payment_method_type

properties.description: A high-level classification of the type of financial instrument that was used to fund a payment. The pattern is not provided because the value is defined by an external party.
properties.name: instrument_type

properties.description: A finer-grained classification of the financial instrument that was used to fund a payment. For example, `Visa card` or a `Mastercard` for a credit card. The pattern is not provided because the value is defined by an external party.
properties.name: instrument_sub_type
